etymology.description: ideogram: top depicts a room in a corridor + bottom 夊 “foot/step” (‘go back’); traditional 復 is semantic 彳 ‘walk’ + phonetic 复.
etymology.interpretation: A footprint returning toward a room conveys the idea of going back, hence ‘return/again’. Later, the walker radical 彳 was added to form 復, clarifying the motion sense while keeping 复 as the sound and core idea.
etymology.simplification: PRC simplification adopted the older phonetic form 复 by dropping the semantic 彳 from 復, effectively reverting to the original graphic that already expressed ‘return’.

examples.chinese: 战后经济逐步复苏(戰後經濟逐步復甦)。
公司下月复工(公司下月復工)。
examples.english: The company will resume work next month.

examples.chinese: 她已经回复了你的邮件(她已經回覆了你的郵件)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yǐjīng huífù le nǐ de yóujiàn.
examples.english: She has already replied to your email.
